    • Constructor Detail

      • MainController

        public MainController()
        Creates a new empty MainController. Before you can use it, you have to set the model and the other controllers, using the setModel(IRestaurant, IMenu) and setMainViewAndControllers(IRestaurantView, IMainViewController, IDialogController) methods.

    • Method Detail

      • setModel

        public void setModel(IRestaurant model,
                     IMenu menu)
        Specified by:
        setModel in interface IMainController
        Parameters:
        model - an IRestaurant instance
        menu - an IMenu instance Set the model classes which will be used during the execution of the program. It is mandatory to call this method every time you create a new instance of this class.

      • setMainViewAndControllers

        public void setMainViewAndControllers(IRestaurantView view,
                                      IMainViewController viewCtrl,
                                      IDialogController dialogCtrl)
        Specified by:
        setMainViewAndControllers in interface IMainController
        Parameters:
        view - The IRestaurantView instance used in the program.
        viewCtrl - Your IMainViewController, which controls the view.
        dialogCtrl - Your IDialogController, which will control the ITableDialog instances. Sets the main view and the related controllers.

        Description copied from interface: IMainController
        Loads the menu from the default location (src/menu.txt).

      • commandLoad

        public int commandLoad()
        Specified by:
        commandLoad in interface IMainController
        Returns:
        the amount of loaded tables, or -1 if the loading failed. Loads a previously saved status of the program. If the loading fails, -1 will be returned, otherwise, the method will return the amount of tables in the loaded file.

      • commandSave

        public void commandSave()
        Description copied from interface: IMainController
        Saves the entire status of the program. You will likely call this method at the exit of the program.
        Specified by:
        commandSave in interface IMainController

      • autoSave

        public void autoSave()
        Description copied from interface: IMainController
        Checks if the autosaving option is selected, and if so, saves the status of the program.
        Specified by:
        autoSave in interface IMainController

      • showMessageOnMainView

        public void showMessageOnMainView(java.lang.String message)
        Specified by:
        showMessageOnMainView in interface IMainController
        Parameters:
        message - a String containing the message Shows a generic message on the main view. You can use this method to show any kind of information, such as notifications or soft errors. If you want to show a severe error, use the IMainController.showIrreversibleErrorOnMainView(String) method.

      • showIrreversibleErrorOnMainView

        public void showIrreversibleErrorOnMainView(java.lang.String message)
        Specified by:
        showIrreversibleErrorOnMainView in interface IMainController
        Parameters:
        message - a String containing the error description Shows a severe error on the main view.

      • getDialogController

        public IDialogController getDialogController()
        Specified by:
        getDialogController in interface IMainController
        Returns:
        the prevoiously set IDialogController instance. Provides the IDialogController which will be used when creating a new ITableDialog. Before calling this method, you must have called the IMainController.setMainViewAndControllers(IRestaurantView, IMainViewController, IDialogController) method at least once, otherwise the behaviour of this method is undefined.
